content.raw: Inertial pose / velocity / acceleration is sometimes interesting too, and sometimes Energy or AngularMomentum (the `Link` class has accessors for these properties)
content.html: Inertial pose / velocity / acceleration is sometimes interesting too, and sometimes Energy or AngularMomentum (the Link class has accessors for these properties)

content.raw: This is relevant if the center of mass is not at the origin of the link frame.
content.html: This is relevant if the center of mass is not at the origin of the link frame.

content.raw: can you elaborate a little more? We should not expose these properties to the plotting tool if CoM is not at link origin?
content.html: can you elaborate a little more? We should not expose these properties to the plotting tool if CoM is not at link origin?

content.raw:
I mean that the Inertial pose / velocity / acceleration will be different from the Link values if the center of mass is not at the origin of the link frame.

If the center-of-mass is at the link origin, then they should be identical.
content.html:
I mean that the Inertial pose / velocity / acceleration will be different from the Link values if the center of mass is not at the origin of the link frame.

If the center-of-mass is at the link origin, then they should be identical.

content.raw: it would be nice to optionally provide conversions for certain messages. For example, the `sec` and `nsec` in time should be combined into a single floating point value for plotting. I imagine users also might be more interested in plotting Euler angles than quaternion components
content.html: it would be nice to optionally provide conversions for certain messages. For example, the sec and nsec in time should be combined into a single floating point value for plotting. I imagine users also might be more interested in plotting Euler angles than quaternion components

content.html:
good idea, updated 47eac65.

@chapulina

content.raw:
Currently, "time" for the user just shows up as one plottable variable. When they drag it, we can internally combine `sec` and `nsec`. We should think about how we're going to display the time axis too. I briefly discussed this with @spaepcke , but I don't think we came up to any conclusion. I have a feeling we will end up formatting it in a similar way to the logging playback and the bottom toolbar.

As for quaternion, I'll change the user's options to euler.
content.html:
Currently, "time" for the user just shows up as one plottable variable. When they drag it, we can internally combine sec and nsec. We should think about how we're going to display the time axis too. I briefly discussed this with @spaepcke , but I don't think we came up to any conclusion. I have a feeling we will end up formatting it in a similar way to the logging playback and the bottom toolbar.

As for quaternion, I'll change the user's options to euler.

content.raw: How do I add a topic to be plotted? Main interest is in outputs of `PhysicsEngine::GetParam`, which could be a scalar or an array of scalars.
content.html: How do I add a topic to be plotted? Main interest is in outputs of PhysicsEngine::GetParam, which could be a scalar or an array of scalars.

content.raw:
you can either publish them to a topic or register them as introspection items. Here's an example `RegisterIntrospectionItems` function in [Model.cc](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/4706ce7180318468e6dbd7aa5bf2e7d16146e268/gazebo/physics/Model.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#Model.cc-1482).

@chapulina are custom introspection items currently being displayed in the Palette?
content.html:
you can either publish them to a topic or register them as introspection items. Here's an example RegisterIntrospectionItems function in Model.cc.

@chapulina are custom introspection items currently being displayed in the Palette?

content.raw: Nope, we haven't decided yet where the custom variables will go in the palette.
content.html: Nope, we haven't decided yet where the custom variables will go in the palette.
